intro: Geigeria pteropoda, commonly known as the mountain nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow with purple veins, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
